thread.title: Coveted DB feels comfortable around UGA staff
thread.title_full: Coveted DB feels comfortable around UGA staff

title: Coveted DB feels comfortable around UGA staff
text:
Coveted DB feels comfortable around UGA staff This coveted DB gives the latest in his recruitment. 
Defensive back Myles Sims (Atlanta/Westlake) has accumulated 30 offers to date. The 6-foot-3, 175-pound junior joined vsporto's SEC Recruiting Buzz this week and said six programs had impressed him with how they have recruited him to date. 
"I would say Duke, Clemson, Ohio State, Michigan, Georgia, and Auburn," Sims said. 
The Bulldogs offered Sims last October. 
"I think Georgia is a building program," Sims said. "They are still new and I believe they still have a lot of growing to do. The recruiting class that they just got will definitely put them where they need to be." 
Sims has a former teammate, Jaden Hunter , who just signed with Georgia. 
"He tells me people overlook Georgia," Sims said. "That they don't know the inside scoop of what is really going on and what Kirby has planned. He says Kirby is going to get the program to the national championship." 
According to Sims, most teams are recruiting him to play corner or nickel. Dell McGee is recruiting him to Georgia, and Sims says he connects well with the staff there. 
"I feel like I could come in and be a big help to the program and just be myself around them," Sims said. "That is just how it is with how they recruit me." 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! ) 
The plan for Sims is to take as many trips as possible in the next few months, gather pros and cons and evaluate from there. He plans to commit before the season starts. 
Listen to the full interview above, which Sims discussing other programs and includes a breakdown of him as a prospect and insight into his recruitment. Stay up to date on SEC recruiting by listening to episodes of the SEC Recruiting Buzz here . Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes here , and on google play here .
